bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Emilie Lawrence Reed and Blossom [Emilie M.] Reed, December 19, 1946

div1.p: Hench asks the Reeds to identify two of their previous homes on photographs he has sent them and asks if they have located any additional letters for him to see.

div1.head: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed and Blossom [Emilie M.], December 19, 1946
div1.opener:
December 19, 1946
Mrs. Walter Reed
Mrs. Blossom Reed
Blue Ridge Summit
Pennsylvania
My dear Friends:
div1.p:
By separate post I am sending you some small enlargements
of snapshots I took at the recent Meeting of the Board of Managers
of the Walter Reed Memorial Association in Washington. I thought
you would like to have them. They were taken with a $5 “flash”
Brownie so please don't compare them to professional photographs.

Mary and I were so pleased to receive your nice
Christmas card. My former secretary, Miss Schnurr, arrives for
a Christmas visit soon--I am anxious to see her notes of our
evening's conversation. I had such a grand time with you all.

After the Christmas rush and when you have time I would
appreciate it tremendously if you would look up the additional
letters and items which you mentioned as having and said you
would let me see. It would be most helpful indeed.

I enclose a picture of the apartment house which
General Kean pointed out to me as being the one in which your
family lived at the time of your father's death. As I recollect
it, you stated that you lived on the first floor in the apartment
on the left of the picture. Is that correct? I am very anxious
to have you identify the spot. Also I enclose a picture of the
house in Blue Ridge Summit which was pointed out to me as being
that of your father. I had a little difficulty in getting someone
to show it to me, but Mr. Harry Cox very kindly drove up with me.
As I understand it, it is on Mount Anglewood and is now known as
the Hahn Place. Is my information correct? I do hope this is
the right house. I will be greatly disappointed if I have been
misinformed.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
